often try to enter Europe via Libya in
2016 and 2017 the most common country of
origin for migrants arriving in Italy
was Nigeria in 2016 almost 40,000 people
crossed into Italy about 18,000 made the
trip in 2017 but numbers have dropped
significantly partly because there's
been a big easy funded crackdown on
people trafficked through Nigeria's
northern neighbor Nazare where
three-quarters of all migrants landing
by boats into Europe come through the EU
has trained in Libyan Coast Guard to
stop migrants in the Mediterranean
returning them to Libya where many are
in crowded detention centers the
crackdown has also made the routes more
dangerous as smugglers have been forced
to take longer routes through the desert
some which have explosive mines since
2017 the International Organization for
Migration has helped return 11,500
Nigerians and data seems to suggest that
most migrants are coming from one area
of Nigeria other states in southern
Nigeria has become a haven for
